content: such as stitch use skill level pattern notes amount and yarn colors and a test skull to crochet make sure to download this file before you start as it also contains the abbreviations used in the patterns later on this also means for now this is the only file there is to download and the actual pattern will be uploaded in four parts from october 4th here are the dates **release of part 1** central flowers sunday october 4th 2020 **release of part 2** black and white including crocheting skulls sunday october 11th 2020 **release of part 3** skull joining and start of flower crowns sunday october 18th 2020 **release of part 4** finishing flower crowns the border and decorating skulls sunday october 25th 2020 every sunday in october i will post a part of this cal however i do not mention a time i will try to post the new part as early as possible on european time zone but if for some reason there might be a delay on the day of release in a week you don t panic out by missing it of course i will announce it when i uploaded a new part this will be done through my website and i will send out an update on ravelry each week within the time range of this cal you can finish your día de los muertos right on time for this year s celebration on november 2nd 2020 - **skill level** intermediate the pattern holds some stitch work for intermediate experience the pattern is written with a lot of detail and with over 100 photos to guide you along anyone who joined in the spice market cal before might already know how detailed it will be however there is only a chart for the skulls and there will be no videos due the fact i am a lefthanded crocheter - **languages available** so far confirmed are english dutch spanish german danish and swedish the swedish introduction guide will be added a few days later due some delay - **testers/translators** many thanks to a wonderful team of testers and translators who helped me bring this pattern alive in many languages and without any errors wendy de vries anette hakansson tineke tap elzbieta sroczynska anja hoberg maria torres julia veloso and christina berberich - **swatching** in the introduction guide you will find a test skull pattern this skull you can crochet as a kick-off to this cal and for the clever ones out there yes it is one of the nine skulls needed you can decide to crochet all nine already but i really don t advice it why you crochet the other skulls in part 2 of the pattern and you would reduce the second week of the cal to a minimum of work crocheting the test skull is also a thing that can deliver size differences if you pick scheepjes catona you can see the size guidelines but if you decide to take different yarn
